programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: An ancient pirate treasure is up for grabs, and when the Captain's curse starts taking victims, a young woman hires Nick and Sylvie to find her grandfather who has gone missing while searching for it.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A woman hires Nick and Sylvie to find her son. She suspects that her missing husband, a professional safe cracker, may have something to do with it. As Nick and Sylvie investigate, they're lead to believe that someone might be after the parents as well.

programme.title: Tropical Heat

programme.desc: Makeva Jenkins, a successful businesswoman and mother of three, boasted on Facebook that she had grown her business to six figures; hours later, she is shot dead with a bullet to the head.

programme.title: Killer Cases
programme.desc: Jazz trumpet player Scott Sessions fails to show up for a gig; his body is found a few days later, wrapped in plastic, partially burned and hidden in a forest; investigators trace his last known whereabouts to the residence of his new love interest.

programme.title: Killer Cases
programme.desc: Todd Kendhammer calls 911 in a panic, describing a freak accident involving his wife; police are suspicious of Todd's responses in the interrogation room; forensic details from the autopsy report cast further doubt on his story.

programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

Award-winning program anchored by David Muir, featuring unforgettable, character-driven true crime mysteries, exclusive newsmaker interviews, hard-hitting investigative reports and in-depth coverage of high profile stories.

programme.title: This Week With George Stephanopoulos
programme.desc: Former Clinton White House staffer and current co-anchor of ABC's weekday morning news show "Good Morning America," George Stephanopoulos and co-anchors Martha Raddatz and Jonathan Karl offer a look at current events with a focus on the politics of the day. Each week's show includes interviews with top newsmakers (including some of the nation's top political leaders) as well as a roundtable discussion, usually featuring journalists from ABC and other news organizations, of the week's happenings. Since 2008, the program has broadcast from a studio at the Newseum in Washington, D.C.

programme.title: Xploration: Animal Science
programme.desc: In this episode we go down on the farm to explore the science of the cow's 4-chambered stomach. Learn about the mysterious muscle disorder that makes certain types of goats faint. Plus, find out what horsepower really is.

programme.title: Xploration: Animal Science
programme.desc: This show features some of the coolest creatures from the continent of South America. Find out how the Jaguar's jaws are able to crush bone. And why the Galapagos Tortoise can grow to nearly 1,000 lbs.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Over millions of years, plants animals, even humans have had to adapt to an Evolving Earth. Travel 1350 ft into the Earth. Follow Dinosaur tracks. Gain insight into our planet's past and reveal how much our landscape has changed.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: The oceans cover 71 percent of our planet and contain countless species, but what's most incredible is that human beings have explored less than 5 percent of the oceans, leading one to wonder what kinds of incredible discoveries are yet to be made.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: Sharks are the ultimate underwater predator, but why? A skunks odor can be dilluted to10 parts per billion and still makes your eyes water. How slow is the 3 toed sloth? From the depth of the oceans to the tops of the trees, this week on Animal Science.

programme.title: Xploration: Animal Science
programme.desc: This show features some of the coolest creatures from the continent of Europe. Find out why the Mongoose is immune to cobra venom. And why 80% of the Dragonfly's brain is used to process what it sees.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1996 Impala throws the guys for a loop when they discover it's an imposter; the team makes it better than ever, with custom body fabrications, rear subframe and handmade interior.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Truck builds tend to get bigger than originally planned, so it's no surprise when a 1971 Suburban goes even bigger with a custom lifted air suspension and interior; a nearly finished 2006 Kodiak needs just one more custom upgrade.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill and his team make one of their longest custom chassis ever for a new 2020 Denali, and Ekstensive gets a diesel pro-mod drag car back on the track.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Ekstensive turns a stock 2020 Denali dually into a frame-dropping, show-stopping work truck; as a final touch, Bill handmakes articulating speakers for the bed; Bill takes a family's minds off their brush with a custom 2019 Polaris Ranger.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The guys bring a 1964 Lincoln back with a late-model Coyote engine and handmade interior; the Sling-Ray is a custom automotive sensation, but Ekstensive has what it's been missing.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1971 Suburban returns to the shop for "phase two," wanting more power and custom metalwork; when a client finds parts and pieces of a '68 C10, Bill and the crew set on a new course for a ground-up build.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill gets déjà vu on a 1985 Chevy C10 square body; a handmade chassis; after a close call, Ekstensive makes a 1923 T-Bucket street safe.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A local client wants the teams help to surprise his dad with a custom 1946 Ford Coupe; Bill goes for a mix of both classy and supercharged when working on his wife's 2021 Escalade.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Ekstensive needs a new shop truck, Bill and the guys go sky-high with a lifted '21 F-450 King Ranch capable of hauling over 20,000 pounds; with most of the '46 Ford Coupe body beyond repair, the team has no choice but to build from the ground up.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The guys hit the home stretch on the '46 Ford Blue Thunder, its once-rusted shell now rebuilt into a one-of-one showstopper; Bill is surprised when John Cena drops off a '69 MGC.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Builds include a 1979 Little Red Express and a Suzuki Samurai lake crosser.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Builds include a Samurai rock crawler and a Gladiator with a Hellcat.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Mod Mafia transforms a fire-damaged M1038 Humvee ambulance into an extreme camping overlander; the Wide Open Garage team builds a bulletproof race car for the appropriately billed Death Car Race, in which drivers are blindfolded.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: A request about a 1947 Ford truck becomes 1 Way Diesel Performance's next ground-up build; Mod Mafia jumps into uncharted territory with a Viper ACRX race car.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Looking into what happens if a Cummins diesel engine is put into a 2004 Lamborghini Gallardo; a customer wants Wide Open Garage to turn an old, rusted Chevy truck into a lifted, all-terrain truck on huge 74-inch tires.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Putting a twin-turbo Cummins into a 2004 Lamborghini Gallardo is a monster build unlike any other for 1 Way Diesel Performance. YouTube's "Unspeakable" star Nathan Graham asks Mod Mafia to help him out of a jam with his all-terrain, amphibious SHERP.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: The 1991 Land Rover Defender is known for ruggedness and simplicity; Mod Mafia does a reboot of a tired, old Defender with modern performance, power and custom luxury; Wide Open Garage takes an old-school Bronco monster truck into overdrive.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Social media star Liver King not only wants Mod Mafia to beef up his prized 2001 H1 Hummer's performance, he wants to customize it for his primal lifestyle; the team at Wide Open Garage must build a custom off-road truck completely from scratch.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Wide Open Garage's mega-truck build gets even bigger as they take an old-school '82 C10 square body and create a one-of-one show truck, monster truck; one Way Diesel Performance lives up to their name by giving an '88 Silverado more than 1,200 horsepower.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: 1 Way Diesel Performance is thrown a mega-curveball with a classic '48 Dodge Power Wagon. In a race pitting garage vs. garage, a 2,700hp diesel truck hits the line against a turbocharged first-generation Camaro.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike trek to Colorado for a 1971 Ford Crew Cab 4x4 tow truck.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: It's the mullet-car showdown, a battle of dirt-cheap beaters: an SN95 Mustang V-6 and a third-gen Camaro with a 305 that's so gutless it might as well be a V-6.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike test out the cars they've built that are still running.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Roadkill brings back a Mazda pickup powered by a 455 Oldsmobile in the bed!

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike take a 1950 Ford truck and add a Chevy transmission.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: People love it when the crew rescues old cars from the junkyard; they literally hack a '56 Buick Century out of a thorn bush it's been sitting in for 25 years.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike score a 1970 Dodge Challenger racer from a fan in Oregon.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: A 1991 Cadillac Brougham is converted into the swingin' Broughammer with a Cummins turbodiesel; with special guests Tony Angelo and Lucky Costa of "Hot Rod Garage."

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike take a 1970 Dodge Challenger to a swap meet for speed parts.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Highlighting the Roadkill Boost Caboose, a trailer with an engine that powers a centrifugal supercharger that sends boost to the tow vehicle.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys get a 1968 Datsun 520 mini truck and a 1971 Plymouth Road Runner.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Roadkill fans always ask to see a competition with hosts David Freiburger and Mike Finnegan; they each buy a car for $1,500 and enter the Optima Ultimate Street Car Invitational in Las Vegas.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike get together with the Mighty Car Mods, Marty and Moog.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David Freiburger and Mike Finnegan host from the annual Hot Rod Power Tour road trip including Roadkill project cars and a never-before-seen Hot Rod show video.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The mayhem is back complete with its new 707hp drivetrain from a 2015 Dodge Charger Hellcat; the off-road Hornet; the Disgustang; the Crusher Impala; time for big action.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan built (or unbuilt) the Vette Kart: an '85 Chevy Corvette stripped to nothing but a chassis and powertrain; now, it's back and the guys try to execute the least-predictable stunt ever.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan drive the mid-engined, GMC Crew Cab, road-going dragster 500 miles to the Roadkill Zip-Tie Drags at Tucson Dragway.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Last time the guys tried to rescue this 1977 Chevy El Camino, the result was a transmission fluid spill that can still be seen from space; now it's back as the guys attempt a road trip to the Merrill Ice Drags on a frozen river in Wisconsin.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Building 440-powered Suzuki Samurai entirely out of a junkyard in Arizona.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Old fashioned, fun road trip in random, unreliable junk; David and Mike buy a 1966 Ford Econoline flat-face pickup, sight unseen, and hit the road.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike play around in hot-rodded pickups with a few friends.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan's loved Chargers since he was a kid; he recently bought a long-abandoned '68 Dodge Charger that's lasted 48 years in as-built condition; Finnegan works with buddies Tony Angelo, David Newbern and Daniel Boshears to bring it back to life.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Taking a 50-year-old car from a junkyard and motoring it to the 14,115-foot summit of Pikes Peak in Colorado.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David, Mike and Steve throw cars off a cliff at Glacier View in Alaska.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The Draguar makes an epic return all the way to racing at NHRA Nationals.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The Vanishing Paint Challenger is back with an upgraded suspension and it's ready to dominate the autocross; David Freiburger and Steve Dulcich enter Tire Rack SCCA Solo Nationals in Lincoln, Neb., a mere 1,700 miles away.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: It's a Roadkill challenge like no other; David Freiburger and Mike Finnegan are joined by Motor Trend hosts for an all-out war on tires.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike salvage a Road Runner that had an encounter with a pole.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike work on improving their Mazdarati mini-truck.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys road trip a big-block 1980 Dodge Mirada to Du Quoin, Illinois.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys road trip two beaters to a deserted factory for a winter battle.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys' attempt at a Hemi Gremmie road trip is foiled by engine trouble.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan buy an '86 Trans Am and take it for its first road test on the drag-and-drive event Sick Week; with a swapped 350 V8 and a six-speed, the big question is whether they be able to make it faster each day or even finish the race.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Freiburger attempt to get a bucket-list '66 Corvette -- abandoned halfway through an LS swap and restoration -- back on the road. With multiple iterations and attempts, the 'Vette hasn't been on the road for 30 years. Will they change that?

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Newbern light the tires as they road test their LS-powered '66 C2 Corvette from Oakland to Las Vegas with the smokiest burnouts ever. Follow along as they blaze the coast and hit the drag strip with Dulcich before breaking down in Sin City.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Steve finds a '71 Pontiac T-37 at a junkyard in Idaho; Mike and David take their time reviving a motor that's been sitting for 38 years.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Newbern give new life to a '57 Chevy Bel Air that was pulled from a junkyard after more than 30 years. The guys drop in a small-block V8 and turbo 350 to get the car back on the pavement for a bumpy road trip back to where it came from.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan meet up with Derek Bieri to take a 1968 big-block Dart on a tire-smoking road trip, which includes a final run down Memphis International Raceway and some high-speed passes down George Ray's Wildcat Dragstrip.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Newbern revive the '73 Chevy Ramp Truck.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan surprises Freiburger by fixing up the Gremmie for Roadkill Nights.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: A road trip keeps Freiburger distracted prior to the Hemi Gremmie surprise.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan drive the Hemi Gremmie from Detroit to St. Louis.

programme.title: Shorty's Dream Shop
programme.desc: Shorty takes on a '69 Camaro, a '65 Impala and a 1940s pull wagon.

programme.desc: Browns running back Nick Chubb scored a 2-yard, go-ahead touchdown with 57 seconds left, and Steelers quarterback Russell Wilson's Hail Mary attempt was batted down in the end zone as time expired as Cleveland wins in the snow 24-19 over Pittsburgh.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Sam Darnold threw for 90 of his 330 yards in overtime to set up Parker Romo's game-ending 29-yard field goal, and Minnesota outlasted Chicago 30-27 on Sunday after giving up 11 points in the final 22 seconds of regulation.

programme.desc: The Dallas Cowboys and Washington Commanders scored a combined 31 points in the final four minutes, the most in an NFL game in more than a decade, but the Commanders came out on the wrong end of it in a defeat that further endangers their playoff chances.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Disguising himself as a milquetoast Easterner who writes Western novels, Hoppy enrolls in a dude ranch in order to unmask the murderer of the owner's husband.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Hoppy suspects the foreman at Lazy J Ranch is behind the rustling of their own delivery of cattle.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Hoppy goes to town to help Marshal Windy with some rustlers and winds up helping the widow Joyce when con-men try to take her herd.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Hoppy tasks Lucky with an undercover assignment to investigate a railroad builder's missing payroll and discovers a conspiracy to halt the construction of a new track spur.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Beautiful new schoolteacher June Lake aims to keep the unruly schoolhouse children in line, but Hoppy gets suspicious when the chauvinistic Mayor Judson Thorpe proposes to her.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Hoppy is up against a phony European "baron" and his gang of horse thieves who have come to buy horses from a desperate Colonel.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Hoppy and a young minister try to convince a boy who's just committed his first holdup that his gunman idol has feet of clay.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: As they ride into an apparently deserted town, Hoppy and Red are shot at, and then discover the town's only resident, also shot and left for dead.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Hoppy and Red discover that two outlaws have ambushed the sheriff of Stone Valley and determine to help the local ranchers against an exploiter who wants to take over the valley and sell it ti the cavalry.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Hoppy fakes amnesia in an attempt to save the cattlemen's bank and the local ranchers from ruin springing from an embezzlement.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Hoppy poses as a cattle buyer in order to break up a ring of thieves who are stealing gold from a smelter.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Hoppy encounters bank robbers who are trying to recover the loot they hid in an old wagon inside the Twin Rivers livery stable.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Hoppy and Red help the U.S. Immigration Service investigate the deaths of smuggled Chinese aliens.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Hoppy tries to prove that a gypsy boy's dead father was not a thief so that the boy can marry his sweetheart.

programme.title: Vengeance Valley
programme.desc: Two sons of a Colorado cattle baron, one biological and the other adopted, grow up and fight for control of their father's business empire.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: An admiral's son helps outlaws steal from the Navy.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: Three men try to silence a murder witness.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: Jose Limantour claims title to land in the city.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: A banker unwittingly becomes Clay Kendall's partner in a fraud scheme.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: An arch-criminal has been run out of New Orleans and is passing through North Fork. Spotting the McCain ranch, he tells McCain he wants to buy it.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Young Dan Willard takes on Marshal Micah Torrence's job. With no experience, he takes a tough stand with a bunch of Texas cowhands whose high spirits are evident at the saloon.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas gets in trouble when he accuses the foreman of a neighboring ranch of rustling some of his cattle.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas and Mark are returning from a big cattle sale when the stage is robbed by three outlaws. Lucas, desperate to recover the money that was stolen, is determined to pursue the outlaws.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: An Argentine family moves to North Fork. The townspeople are unfriendly to them, making fun of their clothing and customs. The Argentinean adult immigrant is openly hostile in return.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas and Mark find themselves exposed to anthrax after they adopt a stray horse whose owner has been killed in a gunfight.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: After the end of the Civil War, General Phil Sheridan, who has been appointed Governor of the New Mexico Territory, is on an inspection tour of the country.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A famous gunfighter marries and decides to retire. He and his wife settle down in North Fork and open a store, but three outlaws arrive in town looking to best him in a gunfight.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: An old friend of Lucas McCain's, a traveling photographer, comes to North Fork plying his trade. When a murder is committed, the photographer is accused of the crime.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: The townsfolk of North Fork decide to give a young couple a shivaree celebration. When the drunken crowd gets out of hand and roughs up the bride-to-be, the young groom challenges them.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: When a young boy from Brooklyn is accused of murder, Mark, believing the boy's claim of innocence, hides him until he can find the real killer.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: U.S. Marshal Sam Buckhart arrives in North Fork in search of renegade Indians suspected of the brutal killing of a Texas Ranger and his family.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Sid Fallon tries to blackmail former gambler Julia Andueza into allowing him to use her boarding house as a gambling hall and saloon.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas puts his life in jeopardy when he agrees to testify in a murder case where the first witness was killed before he could testify, and the killer is still at large.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Outlaw Sam Morley falls in love with a young woman who has a serious illness and asks Lucas to turn him in for the reward and use the money to pay for her medical care.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas welcomes his old friend Tom Birch, who once saved his life, unaware that the man is now a bank robber on the run with his gang.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Dan Maury, released from Yuma prison, arrives in North Fork intent on getting even with Marshal Torrance, who helped send him to jail.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Young Mark McCain is eager to help lawman Jay Jefferson, who has arrived in North Fork intent on killing an outlaw for the reward, whether he is the right man or not.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas comes to the rescue when escaped convicts hold up the general store in North Fork and take Marshall Torrance hostage.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Young Mark manages to capture a hawk but falls into danger with a rattlesnake. A stranger comes to his rescue and Mark invites the man home, unaware that he is on the run from the law.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas takes in an orphaned teen being raised by his abusive uncle after there is trouble at the school.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: The McCains try to be tolerant of their embittered neighbor Abel MacDonald, but they decide he's gone too far when he won't allow his injured boy to get medical treatment.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: An unfounded rumor causes North Fork's outspoken feminist schoolteacher to be attacked by a mob of angry townspeople.

programme.title: Fort Dobbs
programme.desc: After escaping a lynch mob, Gar Davis (Clint Walker) disguises himself in a dead man's clothes and stumbles upon a farm. When Comanches attack the homestead, Gar leaps into action to defend the hapless residents -- widow Celia Gray (Virginia Mayo) and her son Chad (Richard Eyer). A tenuous romance develops between Gar and Celia when he escorts the family to Fort Dobbs. But everything changes when Celia discovers the stranger is wearing her dead husband's jacket.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Sheriff Gene Autry lets a young ranch owner, who is suspected of horse stealing, escape from jail.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Gene gets in unexpected trouble when he befriends an apparently homeless little girl.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: A notorious outlaw steals the payroll from a construction company, fooling his own fiancée into helping him. Gene plans a trap for the gangster when he suspects the plot.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: As a special investigator for an express company, Gene has to turn outlaw to find stolen money.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: As a special agent for a mining company, Gene risks his life to track down bandits who operate from a ghost town.

programme.title: Drums in the Deep South
programme.desc: Two old friends find themselves on opposite sides during the Civil War in a desperate battle atop an impregnable mountain.

programme.title: Ballad of a Gunfighter
programme.desc: Based on the Marty Robbins song "El Paso."

programme.title: The Five Man Army
programme.desc: A bandit (Peter Graves) and his gang target a Mexican general's trainload of gold for the revolution in 1914.

programme.title: The Over-the-Hill Gang
programme.desc: A retired Texas Ranger and his three aging pals set out to clean up a lawless town and remove its evil, corrupt mayor from office.

programme.title: Last Stand at Saber River
programme.desc: From an Elmore Leonard book.

programme.title: Fort Osage
programme.desc: A scout (Rod Cameron) leads a wagon train through territory made hostile by a violated treaty.

programme.title: Sergeant Rutledge
programme.desc: At a U.S. Army fort in the Arizona Territory in 1881, an officer is murdered and his beautiful young daughter is beaten, raped and strangled. Army lawyer Tom Cantrell (Jeffrey Hunter) defends the accused, African-American sergeant Braxton Rutledge (Woody Strode), a soldier who had once been under his command. Under questioning by Cantrell and the prosecutor (Carleton Young), multiple witnesses piece together the truth of what happened at the fort that day.

programme.desc: A vengeful judge who believes Lucas was responsible for his son's death, kidnaps Mark McCain to revenge himself on Lucas.

programme.desc: A handsome Italian count arrives in North Fork. The town bully ridicules his manner of speech and dress and provokes the Count to challenge him to a duel.

programme.desc: Harris makes a big announcement; Ben is overwhelmed with family responsibilities.

programme.desc: Harris takes her anger out on Darlene; Dan and Louise spend an entire day in bed together.

programme.desc: Louise gets into a feud with Becky after accidentally sending a rude message in the family text thread.

programme.desc: Neville confronts Jackie about loaning Dan money; Darlene attempts to play matchmaker for Mark.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Mark's graduation approaches, he considers his relationship with his father; Louise plans a big graduation ceremony at the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A sudden turn of events forces the Conners to face their daily struggles in a way they never have before.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene is in for one surprise after another when David introduces his girlfriend, Blue (Juliette Lewis), and mentions that Mark and Harris will be spending the weekend with them.

programme.title: The Conners

programme.desc: Geena learns D.J. hasn't been taking Mary to church while she's been away, so she insists they go as a family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A family member drops a life-changing announcement; Dan suspects that Becky isn't sticking to her end of the deal about her drinking; Darlene continues her job search.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: With Mark and Mary's help, Jackie convinces Dan to build a chicken coop so the family can eat organic eggs.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan questions Peter's motives when he learns about the pricey Christmas gift Jackie bought for her new unemployed beau. Elsewhere, Mark and Mary write up their Christmas wish list.

programme.desc: When Becky helps Harris keep a secret from Darlene, it causes a split between the two sisters.

programme.desc: When Dan gets injured on the job covering D.J.'s vending machine route, the choice to sue the company could lead to D.J. getting fired.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Darlene grapples with a life-altering offer, a conversation with David turns her world more upside-down.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Emilio's deportation, Jackie takes on a paternal role crafting a birth plan for Becky; Darlene navigates a love triangle with David and Ben; Harris faces her own dilemma.

programme.desc: Darlene struggles to decide between David and Ben; Becky begins to doubt herself as a mom; Mark gets in trouble at school when a picture of him and his boyfriend kissing goes viral

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris confronts Darlene's lifestyle; Jackie meddles in others' affairs to evade her own issues; Becky struggles with the expenses of parenthood, her family lends support.

programme.desc: Dan avoids grief until it confronts him; Ben and Darlene tackle baby fever; Dwight's nervous to fill in for an injured chef.

programme.desc: Dan’s ready to share his feelings with Louise; Darlene realizes how badly she wants a baby.

programme.desc: After suffering the loss of his best friend Charlie on Christmas Eve, sixteen year old Bobby Whiteside ventures out onto the lake where they played countless games of winter hockey. Upon shoveling the ice surface he makes a shocking discovery --- a magic, perfectly groomed hockey rink that appears only at night and only in his presence. When a local construction company purchases the land for development, Bobby must join forces with his high school crush, rally the town, and play one last game on the night pond --- with an old friend.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.desc: Contestants on this dating game show don't want to hear the elimination line "I'm sorry, but you have too much baggage." How much is acceptable among three contestants in each episode is determined by the "dater," who hears the candidates' intimate secrets and hidden flaws, as well as their attempts to deflect these traits by describing their positive attributes. After two elimination rounds leave one remaining contestant, it's the dater's turn to reveal his or her own baggage ... and then the contestant decides to go forward with the date or not. Jerry Springer hosts.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Fashion comes to Wipeout Australia as we meet Adam “God’s Gift” Marshall, a self styled Ad man who conquers the Qualifier. Other Catwalk moments include the Grandpa in his Red Speedos and a Rainbow Bright Personal Ad. If jumping a revolving arm while balancing on a pedestal above water isn’t enough for you then you’ll love this weeks Sweeper. Contestants are armed with Dodgeballs, to be deployed at each other, creating horrific hits and spectacular spills. The Dizzy Dummy claims its first victim as Dummy Tummy rejects a contestant and the Wipeout Zone becomes a battle of young and old.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s no doubt that the ‘Ball Crusher’ Sweeper is the star of tonight’s show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this week’s Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns don’t come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Its neck and neck through the qualifier which this week includes a real Mission Impossible, Dirty Balls. The trash talk is as fierce as the competition and continues to the Wipeout Zone with the winner taking not only the $20,000 but also the glory. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of “violent love”, the Fight Hug.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. It’s all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. It’s a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s Sitcom Central on Wipeout Australia with the Odd Couple, starring World’s Strongest Dwarf, David Clarke and Gentle Giant, Tim Watts. Once again the Big Balls deliver some spectacular moments with an Italian Chef being sliced and diced. Sacks are introduced at the Sweeper proving too much for some, but surprisingly helping the ladies to even things out as we go into a 50/50 male, female split in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Mesmerized by Bon Bon’s Belly Dancing, we catch up with our favourite Big Balls in the Qualifier. They dish out punishment to Australia’s very own female Jim Carrey and send Big Cat tamer Robbie into the pond. Goofy Goggles up the ante on the Dreadmill causing the Breakdancing Dad to create hilarious new moves. Golden Guns, Marisa battles it out for the ladies against Perfect Specimen, Seamus in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Wipeout Australia debunks the myth that only young, fit and funky people should go on game shows. This week we are forced to take notice of Demolition Dave, a 49 yr old South Australia man who thanks to some home training smashes the qualifier. For those lucky enough to survive the Fly Screen Sweeper it was Dizzy Dummy time. Emerging as the Dark Horse, Kobie Mulligan earned herself a shot in the Wipeout Zone, joined by a Strategist and Rubber Woman resulting in a bitter showdown.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: From singing Pastors to Wookies, this week is jammed pack with Characters, who battle it out on the Qualifier with amusing attempts at the inconceivable Field Goal Swing. Its no easy task to earn a spot in the Wipeout Zone this week with the Dreadmill, sorting the men from the boys. Contestants must dodge the wrecking ball while shooting basketballs. Although there is one man who came prepared, Dodgeball Champion Dan Bennett, whose “Duck, Dive, Dip, Dodge and Dunk” training comes into play.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: 20 Greatest Hits

programme.title: MasterChef

programme.desc: S02:E08 - Episode 8

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's program is Clubway 41, despite being voted Blackpool Tourist Board Restaurant of the year, the place is dire straits. It is the prime example of HOW NOT TO RUN A RESTAURANT. Owner DAVE is the flakey self-appointed head chef, who hasn't been in a kitchen for 30 years and can't cook. His partner DAWN invents bizarre dishes for the menu, ranging from "tomato and cointreau soup" to "pork with brie, nectarine and whiskey sauce". Gordon faces a hellish week, Clubway 41 is breaking every rule in book, can he bring Dave, Dawn and their food back to earth?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Tonight's program sees Gordon Ramsay in Oscars in Nantwich. On the surface this place seems idyllic, an Irish family run restaurant in the heart of beautiful countryside. Owner MAURA runs the front of house and her son LENIN is the Head chef, but it's not "happy families". With her life savings on the line Maura is in big trouble. She constantly bickers with her son whilst the customers are forced to wait hours for their fluorescent crab stick paellas, and stodgy carbonaras from Oscars "bit of everything" menu.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Cookery Course
programme.desc: S01:E03 - Stress Free Cooking

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Cookery Course
programme.desc: S01:E04 - Real Fast Food

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's program Gordon Ramsay travels to the seaside to help ailing hotel and restaurant, The Sandgate. This is Lois and Peter's first venture into the catering industry - the happily married couple used to enjoy eating in restaurants, so thought it might be fun to own one. 18months later their dream has turned into a nightmare and they're loosing ~£4,000 a month.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: This week Gordon is at a god-awful Italian restaurant in Derby. La Gondola is stuck in a time-warp with naff Seventies cuisine, bad net curtains and no customers. New owner Daniela bought the place because she got married there back in the day but her sentimentality has blinded her to the fact that she's bagged a white elephant. Gordon's biggest problem is head chef Steve, one of the worst he's ever met, and one who'd rather open a tin of tuna or a packet of soup than create a proper meal. Can Gordon get the kitchen cooking again and save La Gondala from sinking?

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S02:E07 - Episode 7

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S02:E08 - Episode 8

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's program is Clubway 41, despite being voted Blackpool Tourist Board Restaurant of the year, the place is dire straits. It is the prime example of HOW NOT TO RUN A RESTAURANT. Owner DAVE is the flakey self-appointed head chef, who hasn't been in a kitchen for 30 years and can't cook. His partner DAWN invents bizarre dishes for the menu, ranging from "tomato and cointreau soup" to "pork with brie, nectarine and whiskey sauce". Gordon faces a hellish week, Clubway 41 is breaking every rule in book, can he bring Dave, Dawn and their food back to earth?

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S03:E02 - The F Word

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
In tonight's final programme Gordon returns to Momma Cherri's Soul Food Shack, an intimate forty-seater in Brighton where he oversaw one of the most spectacular changes of fortune at a single venue. Owner CHARITA JONES was producing a menu of irresistible unique classics from the Deep South, but at the same facing financial disaster. The punters were missing, and so was her business acumen. But Gordon succeeded in shutting her out of the kitchen, getting the chef back on the boil and putting the soul back into the business.
Today Charita is fully-booked round the clock and bursting out of the Soul Shack to take on the 110-seater Momma Cherri's Big House. But expansion brings a different set of challenges, and she's still struggling to control her staff and manage her success. Has she got what it takes to make the next step up, or will she be forced to rethink her grand plans?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's penultimate programme Gordon returns to La Riviera - now renamed Abstract - a fine dining restaurant in Inverness. Owned by multi-millionaire Barry Larson and costing ~£8000 a week to run, the place boasted top French chef Loic Lefebvre and an impeccably-trained kitchen staff, all of them on a mission to bring sophisticated French cooking to the home of the haggis. But the locals weren't biting and the restaurant was empty most nights. Gordon's recipe for survival forced them to tone down their act and demystify the menu to get the punters in. Today the restaurant's return to form has led to plans for expansion. Loic is still there, and now he's been promoted to Executive Chef he will oversee any new ventures. But can he continue to resist a return to French frills, and has he managed to pull off his own personal ambition, a Michelin star?

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Cookery Course
programme.desc: S01:E05 - Food on a Budget

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Cookery Course
programme.desc: S01:E06 - Baking

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Tonight, for the first time ever on Kitchen Nightmares, Gordon takes on a nightmare restaurant abroad. La Parra de Burriana is an ex-pat restaurant in Nerja on Spain's Costa del Sol. Nestling among the cafes lining the seafront offering all-day English breakfast and chips, La Parra is the brainchild of twenty-six-year-old ex-nightclub manager Laurence. He set himself up in business eighteen months ago with a loan from his dad and, although he's not an experienced chef, mans the kitchen on his own, determined to offer something better than chips to his largely British clientele.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's second programme Gordon tackles a pub for the first time, getting to grips with The Fenwick Arms in rural Lancashire. The pub is run by landlord Brian who, after thirty years in the business and a quadruple heart-bypass, still puts in 120 hours a week and insists on laying down the law in the kitchen. Despite their best endeavours Brian and his partner Elaine are ~£250k in debt, losing ~1500 a week and facing bankruptcy within three months unless there's a drastic reversal in their fortunes.

programme.desc: S02:E09 - Episode 9

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Cookery Course
programme.desc: S01:E05 - Food on a Budget

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's judgement day as the chefs not only learn the top three desserts but the judges announce the winning menu. `Fast Show' writer and performer Charlie Higson helps judge the puddings. Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort decide on the four winning dishes, but there is a problem - they are torn between two dishes for one of the courses.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the climax of the competition as the winning chefs cook at the Comic Relief Banquet at the Royal Albert Hall. Special guest and co-founder of the charity Richard Curtis welcomes guests - the unsung heroes of charity work, as well as those who have benefited from their help and some of the celebrities who have inspired us to do something funny for money.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The three chefs meet their surprise veteran judge and cook their starters. A dish celebrating childhood summer memories takes on a complicated courgette dish and a technically tricky take on the cucumber sandwich.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The atmosphere in the kitchen gets even more intense as all the chefs take risks with their dishes. Mike Reid, executive chef at M Restaurants in London, shocks when he pairs his fish with some highly unusual flavours.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's a smoke filled kitchen as the three chefs prepare their summer-themed mains in the hope of impressing the veteran judge. Selin Kiazim is in her element, cooking a feast inspired by the summer barbecues she enjoyed with her family.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All three chefs are feeling the pressure as they attempt their technical summer desserts. With only the two highest scorers going through to the regional final, who will be sent home?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining London and the South East chefs must cook their entire taste of summer menus again. They're hoping to impress the formidable panel of Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and restaurateur Andi Oliver.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs have been challenged to create outstanding dishes that capture a `taste of summer'. Their menus must reflect the tastes, smells and colours of everybody's favourite time of year.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course and, with a seafood specialist in the kitchen, the competition is stepping up a gear. Tom is hoping he'll be able to elevate the humble mackerel to the standards required for the Wimbledon banquet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With a refined summer barbecue going up against a traditional Cornish speciality and a historic Wimbledon related recipe, who will come out on top? Andy Clatworthy is using his passion for historical cooking to reinvent a dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All three chefs are honouring Wimbledon and the British summer with their technically challenging strawberry desserts. Only the two highest scorers will go through to cook for the judges.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining chefs compete for a place in the national finals. To get there they'll have to impress the formidable panel of judges: Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and restaurateur Andi Oliver.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Tom Parker is eager to impress with a salad that includes 10 elements. Meanwhile, Paul Askew, hopes his traditional techniques will triumph over his younger competitors, and Ellis Barrie is taking a risk with a creative cucumber and oyster starter.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the fish course and the atmosphere in the kitchen gets even tenser as the three newcomers begin to understand the perfection and skill the veteran chef demands. Ellis Barrie attempts to create the flavour of a summer barbecue.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the main course and the pressure is intense in the kitchen. In the hope of impressing the veteran judge, Paul Askew is serving an extremely personal main course based on his mother's favourite food.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Dessert is the last chance for the chefs to secure a place cooking for the judges and the pressure in the kitchen is intense. Paul can't afford to make any mistakes and is pushing himself with a technically challenging baked alaska.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining north west chefs must cook their entire taste of summer menus again. The guest judge is Greg Rusedski, former British number one, who understands the high standards expected at Wimbledon.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning banquet champion Tommy Banks takes on two ambitious newcomers, Danny Parker and Josh Overington. They start by finding out whois the surprise veteran judge and who will be marking their dishes.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The atmosphere in the kitchen gets even more heated, the three chefs are cooking their fish courses. Josh Overington creates a decadent dish inspired by the prestige of the Wimbledon Championships.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs are cooking their main courses and are all taking risks to try and win a place at the banquet. Danny Parker is trying to recreate the flavours of an American barbecue but the veteran chef is dubious about one of his ingredients.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Dessert is the last chance for the chefs to secure a place cooking for the judges and the pressure in the kitchen is intense. All the chefs are using unusual ingredients in their desserts.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining chefs from the north east must cook their entire taste of summer menus again. They're hoping to impress the formidable panel of judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort, Andi Oliver, and guest Judy Murray.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the Scottish regional heats and returning chefs to the competition Michael Bremner and Ally McGrath battle ambitious newcomer Angela Malik for a place in the national finals. This time they are cooking their starters.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The atmosphere in the kitchen gets even more heated and the veteran chef is expecting perfection from the fish course. Ally McGrath creates an inventive dish based on his summer memories of rock pooling in the River Tweed.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Angela Malik is in her element cooking a tiffin box based on memories of summer picnics. Michael Bremner is taking a huge risk, and Ally is creating an inventive dish based on a summer barbeque.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Dessert is the last chance for the chefs to secure a place cooking for the judges and the pressure in the kitchen is intense. Angela Malik is cooking a technically challenging dessert.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two Scottish chefs must cook their entire taste of summer menus again. They're hoping to impress the formidable panel of judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and Andi Oliver. They are joined by guest judge Gary Parsons.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Determined newcomers Paul Croasdale and Nick Brodie take on returning chef Phil Carmichael for a place in the national finals. It's Phil's third time in the competition and this year he's determined to make it to the banquet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The pressure in the kitchen is high as the chefs prepare their fish courses. Paul Croasdale is trying to recreate the elegance of Wimbledon with luxury ingredients such as king crab and scallops.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: For the main course, all three chefs are cooking Welsh lamb in the hope of impressing the judge. Phil is taking a risk with barbecued lamb and in an attempt to elevate a humble barbecue to banquet level, he's serving it with many accompaniments.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the dessert course and the last chance for the chefs to secure a place cooking for the judges so all three chefs are feeling the pressure. Phil Carmichael creates a tennis ball dessert that combines two British classics, Eton mess and trifle.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two winning chefs from the Wales region must cook their entire taste of summer menus again. They're hoping to impress the formidable panel of judges and guest judge Dan Bloxham, Wimbledon's Master of Ceremonies.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Pip Lacey's starter is a humorous take on the unpredictable British weather and features an unusual presentation. Ryan Simpson's dish represents an allotment complete with soil, while Nick Deverell-Smith's creation is a tribute to the precision cutting of Wimbledon's grass.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With the chefs hoping to impress, they each take risks. Pip Lacey combines lobster with strawberry in a tribute to strawberries and cream. Ryan Simpson's also using lobster in his recreation of a BBQ and has invented a technique to create his chips.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Ryan Simpson hopes to elevate a ploughman's lunch into a gourmet affair, Pip Lacey pays tribute to an unusual Wimbledon icon, while Nick Deverell-Smith looks to celebrate a meat which he thinks is underused, venison.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Dessert is the last chance for the chefs to secure a place cooking for the judges. Pip Lacey's pineapple dessert uses coriander. Nick Deverell-Smith also pays tribute to the pineapple, creating a dessert featuring a rice pudding made with couscous.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two chefs who've made it through cook their four courses again. They must impress the formidable panel of judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort, Andi Oliver and guest judge Jordanne Whiley, one of Britain's most successful wheelchair tennis players.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs meet their surprise veteran judge and cook their starters. Eddie is hoping to do better than last year, Joery is hoping to impress with a tribute to Richard Krajicek, and Tommy is creating a warm salad.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Joery Castel is combining mackerel and cucumber, and Tommy Heaney hopes his Murray Mound is a fitting tribute to Andy Murray's love of sushi. Eddie Attwell is creating five different strawberry elements to accompany the scallops in his dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Tommy Heaney's BBQ dish is a surf and turf combination, Joery Castel's aiming to recreate a more American-style BBQ and Eddie Attwell's taking a risk with an unusual meat.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Tommy Heaney's BBQ dish is a surf and turf combination, Joery Castel's aiming to recreate a more American-style BBQ and Eddie Attwell's taking a risk with an unusual meat.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two chefs who have made it through cook their four courses again. They are hoping to impress the formidable panel of judges, Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and Andi Oliver, who are joined by tennis's greatest entertainer, Mansour Bahrami.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With finals week ahead of them, judge Andi Oliver first summons the chefs to Wimbledon to take a look at where they could be cooking if they win. The judges are joined by guest judge Sue Barker, host of the Wimbledon coverage for more than 20 years.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs must cook their fish courses but with some exceptionally high scoring dishes in the regional heats, each chef will need to deliver perfection in order to see off the competition. The judges are joined by guest judge Tim Henman.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is main course day and with only two spots remaining on the banquet menu, the competition is fierce. As the barbecues are fired up, all eight chefs are feeling the heat. The judges are joined by guest judge Gordon Reid.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is dessert day and with just one place remaining at the Wimbledon banquet, each chef is giving everything they have got. The judges are joined by guest judge Annabel Croft, former British number one and Junior Wimbledon champion.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the grand finale and the winning chefs must now cook their dishes at the banquet. Once in the kitchen, the chefs face the huge challenge of scaling up their dishes.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Some of the nation's greatest chefs battle for the chance to cook a glittering Olympic banquet. The feast will honour the hopes and achievements of the country's sporting heroes, and it will be a glorious celebration of Britain's culinary talents. This time it is the battle of the Scottish chefs - returning contender Alan Murchison and newcomers Colin Buchan and Mark Greenaway.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning contender Alan Murchison and newcomers Colin Buchan and Mark Greenaway must cook their fish course, but which one will prevail? Will it be grilled mackerel with beetroot meringues and horseradish ice cream, crab `cannelloni' or poached halibut with squid ink? Great British Menu veteran Jeremy Lee will decide who goes through to the judges.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Sir Matthew Pinsent takes time out to meet one of the chefs and give them valuable tips on competing at the highest level. All three chefs are determined to knock out their rivals in the race to the banquet. This is the big one, the main course, but which one will get top marks? Will it be barbecued veal with macaroni cheese, spinach and watercress; beef rump and terrine; or loin of blackface lamb with sweetbreads?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Scottish chefs - returning contender Alan Murchison and newcomers Colin Buchan and Mark Greenaway. All of them are determined to knock out their rivals in the race to the banquet. This is the final chance to impress `Great British Menu' veteran Jeremy Lee with their dessert dishes - `Going for Gold', modern day Eton mess, and beetroot cake with chocolate mousse and fennel ice cream.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is decision time for the chefs from Scotland. The two remaining chefs cook their entire menus for the `Great British Menu' judges, Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. The judges aren't easily pleased and only world class cooking will do. Only one chef can make it through to the national finals to represent Scotland. If they win, one of their dishes could be on the menu at The Olympic Feast.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Central chefs Aktar Islam and Daniel Clifford and newcomer Paul Foster kick things off with their starters, but which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be pork neck with ribwort plantain and pork scratchings, veal tartare with caramelised sweetbread and burnt onions or breast of squab with confit leg and chilli and sweetcorn shoots?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs Aktar Islam, Daniel Clifford and Paul Foster cook their fish course, but which one will prevail? Will it be poached ray wing with chicken skin and sea vegetables, stuffed red mullet with roasted artichoke and parmesan puree, or pickled mackerel with smoked langoustine and infused coconut milk?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs Aktar Islam, Daniel Clifford and Paul Foster cook the big one, the main course, but which one will get top marks? Will it be Goosnargh duck breast and hearts with potatoes cooked in pine, slow poached chicken and sweetcorn egg or coriander crumbed lamb loin with sweetbread bhajis and pea pulao?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the final chance for chefs Aktar Islam, Daniel Clifford and Paul Foster to impress Glynn Purnell as they make their desserts - whipped sea buckthorn with meringue and crispy rice, raspberry and tarragon roulade with cookie dough and tarragon oil, and dark chocolate with raspberry jelly and raspberry sorbet. Plus, paralympian Daniel Greaves offers his advice to one chef.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's decision time for the chefs from the Central region. One chef has already left the competition and only two remain to cook their entire menus for the judges - Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. The judges are not easily pleased and only world class cooking will do. Only one chef can make it through to the national finals to represent the Central region at a glittering Olympic Banquet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: In this battle of the North East chefs, returning contender Stephanie Moon and newcomers Colin McGurran and Charlie Lakin prepare their respective starters. Which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be Stephanie's goat's cheese, Charlie's wild rabbit with carrot and Douglas fir needles, or Colin's quail in the woods?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning contender Stephanie Moon and newcomers Colin McGurran and Charlie Lakin cook their fish course here. Which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be Stephanie's `see food', Charlie's beetroot marinated monkfish with cauliflower and sea radish, or Colin's mullet on the sea bed?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning contender Stephanie Moon and newcomers Colin McGurran and Charlie Lakin cook their main course here. Which one will take gold? Will it be Stephanie's `team spirit re-vealed', Charlie's Dexter beef, Littlebourne snails, marrow bone and wild garlic, or Colin's hay-smoked pig's head with mock apple and textures of onion?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning contender Stephanie Moon and newcomers Colin McGurran and Charlie Lakin have a chance to impress with their dessert dishes. Will it be Stephanie's `podium of puddings', Charlie's Earl Grey and strawberry souffle with gorse flower ice cream, or Colin's chocolate, rhubarb and custard?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's decision time for the chefs from the North East region. One chef left the competition on the previous day and only two remain to cook their entire menus for the `Great British Menu' judges Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. The judges aren't easily pleased and only world-class cooking will do. Who will make it through to the to represent the North East region in the finals.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: In the battle of the Northern Ireland chefs - returning contenders Chris Fearon, Chris Bell and Niall McKenna begin with their starters. Which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be Chris Bell with tea and biscuits, rabbit, black pudding and rhubarb salad; Niall with pig sweetbreads, black truffle and baked onion; or Chris Fearon with clay pigeon shoot?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning contenders Chris Fearon, Chris Bell and Niall McKenna cook their fish course, but which one will prevail? Will it be Chris Bell's red wine poached turbot and bourguignon of snails; Niall's turbot with asparagus, blood orange sauce and rose powder; or Chris Fearon's skate rings?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning contenders Chris Fearon, Chris Bell and Niall McKenna cook their main course here, but which one will take gold? Will it be Chris Bell's roast lissara duck, bakewell tart, cocoa and basil; Niall's dexter beef with miso and fresh almonds; or Chris Fearon's spring jump lamb?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning contenders Chris Fearon, Chris Bell and Niall McKenna present their dessert dishes. Will it be Chris Bell's summer salad of jasmine panna cotta, apricots and pistachio cake; Niall's apple sorbet, elderflower custard and whiskey jelly; or Chris Fearon's the torch? Plus, Olympian Amir Khan gives valuable tips on competing at the highest level.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's decision time for the chefs from the Northern Ireland region. With two chef's remaining, the must cook their entire menus for the `Great British Menu' judges Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. The judges aren't easily pleased and only world-class cooking will do. Just one chef can make it through to the National Finals to represent Northern Ireland.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning contenders Johnnie Mountain and Aiden Byrne along with newcomer Simon Rogan kick things off with their starters. Johnnie makes foie gras ice cream, cherry ravioli and iberico ham; Aiden offers black cherry and foie gras terrine with palm sugar mousse; and Simon's entry is grilled salad, truffle custard, cheese foam and cobnut crisp.

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Across the country `Gardeners' World' presenters, from their own gardens and homes, give advice and share their knowledge to enable people to get the most out of their gardens. For further inspiration, professionals, horticulturists and hobby gardeners provide fellow green-fingered enthusiasts with useful tips and suggestions, no matter the size of garden or level of expertise. Whether it is creating depth in a small, backyard garden or how to make the most of the latest spinach crop with homemade pesto, presenters prove that the possibilities are endless for any gardener and garden.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don uncovers the extraordinary stories behind Britain’s seventeenth century gardens.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don arrives in the eighteenth century, an age that gave rise to the landscape garden.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty visits influential gardens of the 19th Century, from royal retreats to the very first public parks.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty concludes his journey by looking at how the nation’s gardens have evolved over the last hundred years.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens

He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty assesses the progress, successes and failures of his paradise garden. Elsewhere, Frances Tophill travels to Glasgow to meet a gardener whose hands-off approach to his garden has reaped rewards for wildlife.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: A truck driver from Wakefield with a passion for flowers wants to create a perfect outside space for his girlfriend and burgeoning family, while in Swindon a widow wants to find the best way of turning her bleak patch of green into a cottage garden.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty travels to two corners of the country where the challenges he faces are very different. On the south coast he is presented with a front garden ravaged by salty winds, and in Snowdonia he helps a mountainside garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team return with a celebration of spring. There's been plenty going on over the winter and lots of new projects in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential rose pruning, Monty plants clematis and rocket, cuts back grasses and makes a start on sowing annuals for colour this summer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As plants begin to show their early growth, Monty gets plenty of plants for free when he demonstrates how to make the most of herbaceous perennials. He also cuts back pelargoniums that have overwintered in the greenhouse and makes a start on sowing vegetables. Nick Bailey shares plans for his new garden in Northamptonshire and shows how to create a container garden ideal for those on the move. Frances Tophill discovers more ways to use cut flowers as she visits a florist in Devon.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With spring gaining momentum, Adam Frost gets to work on his veg plot and plants his first lot of potatoes. He introduces roses to his borders, and in a quest to increase biodiversity, has a radical plan for his lawn. Joe Swift meets a garden designer who, facing the challenge of two awkward, adjoining plots, transformed them into wonderful, cohesive spaces. And Rekha Mistry demonstrates how to grow the perfect onion from seed and has a go at growing cotton.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty adds some interest to the spring garden. He also sows peas and shallots, has some thrifty tips for petunias, and plants lilies in pots. Carol Klein visits Mothecombe Gardens in Devon, which has been designed specifically for pollinators, with swathes of nectar-rich daisies and lavender.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty prepares for late spring and summer, while Toby Buckland revels in some spring planting at Melbourne Hall in Derbyshire. Rachel de Thame meets a dahlia grower who once worked at the White House.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don uncovers the extraordinary stories behind Britain’s seventeenth century gardens.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don arrives in the eighteenth century, an age that gave rise to the landscape garden.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty visits influential gardens of the 19th Century, from royal retreats to the very first public parks.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty concludes his journey by looking at how the nation’s gardens have evolved over the last hundred years.

programme.desc: With the drought ending and rain headed their way, the crew hunts the final days of the first split in Bayou Black with new friends Jesse Griffiths and Dirk Sorrells.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: There is a place in Florida that not many people have heard about. The Forgotten Coast, Ever heard of it? Didn’t think so. Let’s discover it together.

programme.title: The Hunted Land & Sea
programme.desc: The Hunted Land & Sea series premiere. Meet the cast, see the home ranch and learn the story behind the series origin while getting a small taste of what is to come with a Nilgai hunt in Texas.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "In this episode of Huckberry Homes, we traveled down to Jacksonville, Florida to meet up with longtime friend, GORUCK Co-founder, and former Special Forces Green Beret Jason McCarthy. When he’s not rucking to and from the GORUCK HQ, you can find him and his friends putting on grueling garage workouts that are the talk of the neighborhood. Huckberry and GORUCK go way back, we’ve shared plenty of good times, GORUCK Challenges, and (more than) a few beers along the way. Their military-grade lineup is designed to be taken to hell and back in the field. So whether you’re traveling the world or “embracing the suck” with a 30 LB plate in your rucksack, you can be sure your gear’s up to the challenge."

programme.title: HUnting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and his brother Tai take us around a new investment property - a 55 acre tract in Wilkinson County, MS and go over what it took to take an undesirable raw tract, to a place with multiple offers on the first day it was put on the market.

programme.title: Bearded Buck
programme.desc: We are back in Pennsylvania for the start of archery season as Austin continues his 2 year quest for a buck we call Elliot. This buck has been a resident on the farm for at least 3 years now but every archery season he seems to turn into a ghost. After hunting him all of last year with no luck, Austin is hoping that this is the year that it will all finally come together.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoors
programme.desc: Capt. Blair and Brian Sanders and guest Capt. Garret George head way out into the gulf from everglades city Florida
