programme.title: Operation Pisces: Money Laundering For The Medellin Cartel
programme.desc: DEA Agent JD Miller is laundering money for the Medellin cartel. He needs help with the sheer volume of cash pickups so he brings in veteran undercover operative Louis Diaz to manage the West Coast operations. Together, JD and Louis run a scheme that also funds the DEA's evidence building efforts against Colombian kingpin, Jose Lopez. When they have enough recorded conversations and seized evidence against the kingpin, they take down Lopez and unearth his sprawling criminal enterprise.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Sometimes, would-be criminals are their own worst enemies. This episode highlights crime “fails,” and the officers - and ordinary civilians - who save the day.

programme.title: Completed Episodes
programme.desc: A show first! A woman and her boyfriend each try their hand at Frank Nicotero's trivia questions to see who can win the most money.

programme.title: FIXT: Veteran Faces Terrifying Decision
programme.desc: Andrew returned home from serving his country with a toothache so bad he covers his mouth out of habit. Mickey had forgotten how to smile after years of struggle with addiction and abuse. Will the FIXT team help them smile again?

programme.title: Show Me Milwaukee
programme.desc: Milwaukee was built on a foundation of social clubs and communal effort. Former Emmy Award winning WISN reporter Shar Borg shows Greg her favorite community building businesses and activities.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Two serial killers whose chilling crimes left their communities devastated.

programme.title: Human Race by Runner's World
programme.desc: 84% of women have been harassed while running. Not Today, by Runner's World, examines this through the stories of three runners. Mollie Tibbetts and Wendy Martinez were both brutally murdered, while Kelly Herron fought off her attacker and survived.

programme.title: Lost Innocence: The Tragedy of Harmony Montgomery
programme.desc: A police investigation into a missing seven-year-old girl in Manchester, New Hampshire reveals harrowing details that shock the state. But even more disturbing is the discovery that the tragic outcome could have been avoided.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Weeks after a pregnant woman is shot and killed in Orlando, a shootout between her suspected killer and a police officer sparks a manhunt.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Speed down a racetrack that's open to all, watch a robot milk a cow, and dine on Greek cuisine in a restored church. Interact with the history of America's most notable sports car and unbox some hot chicken in Bowling Green, Kentucky.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Chefs Jason Hisley and Amanda Mack are going head to head in a sweet treats challenge. Can the chefs create a winning sweet and savory meal? Or will this be a sugar rush they want to forget?

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Ivan Gomez is on a weight loss journey, but it’s one that’s been limited to exercising in his home. Kinga meets Ivan in Stockton, CA to show him how the outdoors can be a personal gym for body, mind and spirit.

programme.title: What's On The Menu?
programme.desc: Eating vegan is good for animals, the environment, and your health. Can it also be good for your taste buds? In this episode, we take a behind the scenes look at some of Pittsburgh’s most popular vegan restaurants.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: Luke is a Kansas City bachelor who is finally ready to settle down. He’s purging the dating apps and hoping to find the perfect match. He’ll meet three blind dates as they play pickleball, get their shuffleboard on and visit a llama farm.

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot
programme.desc: Local Kansas City notables Chef Shanita, Don Daughtry Sr., and the owners of Duet share where to go for cinnamon whiskey, an immersive historical experience, yoga with plants in paradise and more!

programme.title: Maddy & Dixie Take Sactown
programme.desc: Maddy & Dixie are always looking for that next new thing. Join them as they explore a few of Sactown's surprising offerings, from mobile archery to an intimate cocktail bar with over 700 bottles of unique liquor.

programme.title: Absolutely Albuquerque
programme.desc: Amanda faces the heat while blowing glass, learns how to make one-of-a kind designer cookies and tries her hand at DJ 101 with slam poet Hakim Bellamy.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Love is all around us when you take the time to look. Whether it’s a couple still falling in love, or a community organizer making sure every child has a birthday party, there are heartwarming stories all across this country.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Witness extreme car chases captured on video, from fleeing via fire truck to off-roading into a corn field. Fortunately no one is seriously hurt – except, at times, the vehicles.

programme.title: The Spark
programme.desc: Dancer. Educator. Diplomat. Peacemaker. Aysha Upchurch is a force of nature. But it’s her gift for inspiring students that makes her the real star.

programme.title: My Amazing Cheap Date
programme.desc: Two couples sample bites from around the world, cozy up in nature, get hopped up on caffeine and seek out a yoga glow on two blind dates in Orlando.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Join host Rob Mariano, also known as Boston Rob from the Survivor series, as he explores the best of Beantown from classic institutions to new local gems.

programme.title: Ballin' in Baltimore
programme.desc: Join WNBA player and Olympian Angel McCoughtry as she shows us the people and places that put Baltimore on the map. From sailing the Chesapeake, to sampling street foods, McCoughtry pulls back the curtain on what makes the Charm City so special.

programme.title: Bringing Down The House: The Bombing of Harvey's Casino
programme.desc: In the summer of 1980, two men wheeled what looked like an IBM computer into a Lake Tahoe casino. The events that followed rocked the industry, baffled bomb technicians, and changed the lives of a criminal’s and a casino magnate’s family forever.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Experience serious vacation vibes and discover some of the most special corners of America on this guided tour of must-visit cities.

programme.title: Show Me Milwaukee
programme.desc: Local radio personality, Greg Adams, wants to shine a light on all parts of his beloved city and prove that Milwaukee has a lot more to offer than people might expect. In each episode, Greg is joined by a notable personality from the community who shows him their favorite spots and the best ways to experience them.

programme.title: FIXT
programme.desc: David suffered from a blood disorder and hasn’t had a full set of teeth since he was 12. Heather struggles with a rare genetic condition that put her in dentures in her 20s. Can the FIXT team write the final chapter in their health journeys?

programme.title: FIXT
programme.desc: A horrific accident doomed Allison to a lifetime of pain and failed surgeries. In search of a brighter smile, Mar-cia’s seen half a dozen dentists, but remains unsatisfied. Can FIXT tech meet the needs of their deserving clients?

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: In this game show, comedian Frank Nicotero hits the streets to ask people questions inspired by the wildest news stories for a chance at winning a cash prize. These real-life stories with unreal outcomes will make you say, “Wait, What Happened?"

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot
programme.desc: No one knows a city like the locals who live there. This series taps into the insider knowledge of notable figures including musicians, athletes, chefs, artists, influencers, and others who share their best spots to hit up in the city.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Crimes, Cons & Capers explores some of the wildest headline-grabbing crimes and far-fetched escapades from across the country including bizarre love scams, high-speed car chases, risky prison breaks and more.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Experience serious vacation vibes and discover some of the most special corners of America on this guided tour of must-visit cities.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Watch things heat up in the kitchen as two local chefs go head-to-head to create a three-course meal utilizing ingredients sourced from one of the city’s unique marketplaces.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each other’s signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponent’s creation.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Join New Hampshire-based band Recycled Percussion as they perform acts of kindness in their community, and across the country. In each episode, you'll witness the great lengths and hilarious things they're willing to do in the name of kindness.

programme.title: FIXT
programme.desc: David suffered from a blood disorder and hasn’t had a full set of teeth since he was 12. Heather struggles with a rare genetic condition that put her in dentures in her 20s. Can the FIXT team write the final chapter in their health journeys?

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A man vanishes from a boarding house in 1988. The fight to find him uncovers one of the most shocking cases in Sacramento history and the surprising revelation of a grandmotherly-looking serial killer hiding in plain sight.

programme.title: Americas Most Delish
programme.desc: Uncover the Midwest's unexpected. From quirky to inventive flavor mash-ups like the bulgogi burger to the questionable sour cream & raisin pie, see how the area crafts some interesting but delightful culinary concoctions.

programme.title: My Perfect Day
programme.desc: Catalina, a 10-year-old community hero with a heart of gold spends her days giving back. Today, Meaghan surprises Catalina with a day of her own, from Sea adventures to a new set of wheels and more. It's her time to shine.

programme.title: On The Job
programme.desc: Orlando expert, Brendan O'Connor, celebrates the people behind the scenes of the businesses that make Orlando a truly unique place. Join him as he rolls up his sleeves and receives hands on training while spending a day with them, On The Job.

programme.title: Lowrider Legacy
programme.desc: Lowrider Legacy follows celebrated lowrider families, scholars, and activists and documents the history of resistance on wheels that has defined lowrider culture.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: These stories center on people who saw others facing tough times in the midst of the pandemic and decided to do something about it.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: To Grandma's House we go! Chefs Mike Boggs and Nancy Longo face off, cooking up their favorite family recipes, but can they remember how Grandma used to make it?

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Anthony Carignan is a bookish 26-year-old who has never felt at ease in the outdoors. Kinga has come to Maine to help Anthony connect with nature and live out his dream of becoming an authentic Mainer.

programme.title: FIXT: Veteran Faces Terrifying Decision
programme.desc: Andrew returned home from serving his country with a toothache so bad he covers his mouth out of habit. Mickey had forgotten how to smile after years of struggle with addiction and abuse. Will the FIXT team help them smile again?

programme.title: Queens of Birmingham
programme.desc: Queens of Birmingham invites you to slip into your high heels and sashay over the rainbow. Join the DREAMCAST of Al's on 7th, the region's preeminent drag bar, and meet the fiercest divas in the South.

programme.title: My Amazing Cheap Date
programme.desc: Local New Orleans eats, levee tours and Cajun and African drum dancing on two cheap dates in New Orleans.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: After a snowy day in Western Pennsylvania, a horrifying discovery leads investigators down a heartbreaking and twisted path. They'll seek swift justice for an innocent victim deceived.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A teenager vanishes from her home one fall morning in 1999. Her body is discovered 17 days later, seven miles away. It takes more than 15 years for the heartbreaking truth to come out.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Kinga is in Manchester, NH, to meet Matt Krajcik, a 26-year-old curriculum developer who survived a trying childhood. Now he is looking to reconnect to the nature around him that provided respite when he was young.

programme.title: Free Spirit
programme.desc: Master bartender Kate Gerwin visits Kansas City to talk whiskey, taste the nonalcoholic future at an innovative new bar, experience jazz at the Mutual Musicians Foundation, and learn all about Prohibition in the city that ignored it best.

programme.title: Maker Nation Challenge
programme.desc: It’s time to saddle up as three Oklahoma natives pull themselves to victory creating original screen print deigns encapsulating the Old West. Do these makers have the true grit it takes to be Maker Nation Champion?

programme.title: Lost Innocence: The Tragedy of Harmony Montgomery
programme.desc: A police investigation into a missing seven-year-old girl in Manchester, New Hampshire reveals harrowing details that shock the state. But even more disturbing is the discovery that the tragic outcome could have been avoided.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Sports teams would be nothing without their fans, who bring more than passion to the game. From the pros to the high schoolers, these stories show how being a fan can create a community.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Go climbing, sample sizzling hot dogs and cold beer, throw a few axes and explore the rich history on the border of PA & Ohio.

programme.title: Show Me Milwaukee
programme.desc: KISS-FM radio host, Alley Faith joins Greg to explore places that put Milwaukee on the map. They visit the Harley Davidson Museum, a unique cheese creamery and ring the bell with Mayor Cavalier Johnson atop what was once the world's tallest building.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Charm City becomes Carb City in this bread-driven battle. Watch as chefs Ferhat Yalcin and Jonathan Hicks see who can carbo-load their way to victory.

programme.title: What's On The Menu?
programme.desc: Sourcing high-quality, fresh ingredients can be a challenge in an urban area like Pittsburgh. Meet chefs and restaurant owners who are going the extra mile to serve up fresh farm-to-table cuisine.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Rob proves that this iconic locale is more than just Ivy League. He makes pasta from scratch, crafts a custom knife and tries to make an escape from one of the toughest spots in all of Beantown.

programme.title: Only In
programme.desc: Where can you find sweet and savory pies, an art studio painting outside the lines, and an employee-run market with a free food option? The same place where Onion Burgers were born and "vegetable" is a relative term.

programme.title: Stitch

programme.title: Animals on the Farm
programme.desc: In this episode we go down on the farm to explore the science of the cow's 4-chambered stomach. Learn about the mysterious muscle disorder that makes certain types of goats faint. Plus, find out what horsepower really is.

programme.title: South America's Coolest Creatures
programme.desc: This show features some of the coolest creatures from the continent of South America. Find out how the Jaguar's jaws are able to crush bone. And why the Galapagos Tortoise can grow to nearly 1,000 lbs.

programme.title: Evolving Earth
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau travels to Utah where scientists have discovered a massive amount of dinosaur bones. We also go to an area where dinosaur footprints have been preserved. Then we visit Hawaii and see how these islands evolved from volcanoes. Philippe then tours an old coal mine in Pennsylvania and explores the fascinating way fossil fuels were formed.

programme.title: Ocean Exploration
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau visits the famous Woods Hole Oceanographic Institute and finds what discoveries they've recently made under the deep sea. Then we travel to the Florida coast where Philippe goes scuba diving to observe the health of their coral reefs. Then we go to Maui, Hawaii and explore the power of their massive waves with the help of a professional surfer.

programme.title: Creatures of North America
programme.desc: This show features some of the coolest creatures from the continent of North America. Find out how Canada Geese can fly over 600 miles in a single day. And how the Beaver is able to build dams stretching over 2,000 ft.

programme.title: Europe's Coolest Creatures
programme.desc: This show features some of the coolest creatures from the continent of Europe. Find out why the Mongoose is immune to cobra venom. And why 80% of the Dragonfly's brain is used to process what it sees.

programme.title: Station Nightclub Fire
programme.desc: A survivor reflects on The Station nightclub fire on February 20, 2003 in West Warwick, Rhode Island. One hundred people died and more than 200 were injured. The fire was sparked by pyrotechnics that went off during metal band, Great White's performance. The episode looks at who did and didn't take responsibility for the fire and fire code safety measures that have changed since.

programme.title: Surfside Collapse
programme.desc: On June 24, 2021, the Champlain Towers South, a beachfront condominium in the Miami suburb of Surfside, Florida partially collapsed, killing 98 people. Family members of victims and a WPTV anchor reflect on the tragedy. The episode looks at changes in building codes and laws and research on saltwater corrosion.

programme.desc: In collaboration with "The Marshall Project." In-depth stories on criminal justice - including health care in prisons and jails, staff shortages and controversial forensic evidence.

programme.desc: A wayward ex-marine drifts through central Oregon, off everyone's radar. He's homeless and forgotten about, committing petty crimes here and there, until one day he spots Amyjane and gets the urge to kill.

programme.title: Doctor Death

programme.title: The Jigsaw Man
programme.desc: Terror strikes London, England as severed body parts start showing up at random locations across the countryside. Police must piece together the human jigsaw puzzle in order to track down the perpetrator, a common thug who's mastered the dark art of body dismemberment.

programme.title: Animals on the Farm
programme.desc: In this episode we go down on the farm to explore the science of the cow's 4-chambered stomach. Learn about the mysterious muscle disorder that makes certain types of goats faint. Plus, find out what horsepower really is.

programme.title: South America's Coolest Creatures
programme.desc: This show features some of the coolest creatures from the continent of South America. Find out how the Jaguar's jaws are able to crush bone. And why the Galapagos Tortoise can grow to nearly 1,000 lbs.

programme.title: Evolving Earth
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau travels to Utah where scientists have discovered a massive amount of dinosaur bones. We also go to an area where dinosaur footprints have been preserved. Then we visit Hawaii and see how these islands evolved from volcanoes. Philippe then tours an old coal mine in Pennsylvania and explores the fascinating way fossil fuels were formed.

programme.title: Ocean Exploration
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau visits the famous Woods Hole Oceanographic Institute and finds what discoveries they've recently made under the deep sea. Then we travel to the Florida coast where Philippe goes scuba diving to observe the health of their coral reefs. Then we go to Maui, Hawaii and explore the power of their massive waves with the help of a professional surfer.

programme.title: Creatures of North America
programme.desc: This show features some of the coolest creatures from the continent of North America. Find out how Canada Geese can fly over 600 miles in a single day. And how the Beaver is able to build dams stretching over 2,000 ft.

programme.title: Europe's Coolest Creatures
programme.desc: This show features some of the coolest creatures from the continent of Europe. Find out why the Mongoose is immune to cobra venom. And why 80% of the Dragonfly's brain is used to process what it sees.

programme.title: Oregon Coast
programme.desc: Jefferson Graham takes us on a photowalk through Oregon Coast

programme.title: Santa Fe, New Mexico
programme.desc: Jefferson Graham tours Santa Fe, New Mexico and shows us how to capture the best photos of the city's beautiful landmarks with your phone.

programme.title: Station Nightclub Fire
programme.desc: A survivor reflects on The Station nightclub fire on February 20, 2003 in West Warwick, Rhode Island. One hundred people died and more than 200 were injured. The fire was sparked by pyrotechnics that went off during metal band, Great White's performance. The episode looks at who did and didn't take responsibility for the fire and fire code safety measures that have changed since.

programme.title: Surfside Collapse
programme.desc: On June 24, 2021, the Champlain Towers South, a beachfront condominium in the Miami suburb of Surfside, Florida partially collapsed, killing 98 people. Family members of victims and a WPTV anchor reflect on the tragedy. The episode looks at changes in building codes and laws and research on saltwater corrosion.

programme.title: The Inside Story
programme.desc: In collaboration with "The Marshall Project." In-depth stories on criminal justice - including health care in prisons and jails, staff shortages and controversial forensic evidence.

programme.title: The Inside Story
programme.desc: In collaboration with "The Marshall Project." In-depth stories on criminal justice - including health care in prisons and jails, staff shortages and controversial forensic evidence.

programme.title: Crypto Crash
programme.desc: What was behind the collapse of crypto giant FTX? And what does it say about digital currencies, celebrity endorsements, and the collision of tech and finance?

programme.title: Stranded At The Border
programme.desc: In Real Life shows the reality at the U.S.-Mexico border, where people are living in dangerously poor conditions while seeking asylum.

programme.title: The Slavemaster
programme.desc: A father, husband and businessman by day transforms into a sadomasochistic by night. This veteran con-man lures unsuspecting women with a web of lies and empty promises only to trap them in a world of sex slavery and murder.

programme.title: An Opportunity To Kill
programme.desc: A wayward ex-marine drifts through central Oregon, off everyone's radar. He's homeless and forgotten about, committing petty crimes here and there, until one day he spots Amyjane and gets the urge to kill.

programme.title: A Treacherous Triangle
programme.desc: Two prominent doctors, two towns apart, are entangled in a passionate rivalry for the same woman's affections. When one loses, he exacts the ultimate revenge, hiring a friend to take out the opposition.

programme.title: Doctor Death
programme.desc: For more than a decade, a genius doctor with a homicidal hobby gets away with murder at hospitals across two continents. Cops race against incredible odds to track him down just before he takes his next job and kills…again.

programme.title: The Jigsaw Man
programme.desc: Terror strikes London, England as severed body parts start showing up at random locations across the countryside. Police must piece together the human jigsaw puzzle in order to track down the perpetrator, a common thug who's mastered the dark art of body dismemberment.

programme.title: Fit To Kill
programme.desc: A beautiful brunette is killed and left inside a burned out luxury car in the high desert. At first, it seems as though the perpetrators have gotten away with murder. As cops investigate the brutal homicide, they find a trail of missteps, which they trace back to two muscle-bound, married murderers.

programme.title: Redneck Retribution
programme.desc: A scorned mistress exacts the ultimate revenge, hiring a group of derelicts to kill the wife of her lover. When the heat comes, she plays the victim and denies any involvement, but no level of acting will allow her to escape the cold truth, the murder was caught on camera.

programme.title: KATC 5:30 pm News
programme.desc: KATC News in Acadiana - The latest local and national news and local weather, traffic and sports.

programme.title: Judgment Of Jodi Arias With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: The discovery of Travis Alexander’s body, riddled with stab wounds, his throat slit and shot in the back of the head, shocked his friends and family. What didn’t shock them was when Arizona police charged his on-again off-again girlfriend Jodi Arias with his murder.

programme.title: Legalizing The New Death
programme.desc: In a follow up to our spring 2022 episode, we're exploring the debate around states legalizing a new form of death care.

programme.title: Plastic Time Bomb
programme.desc: A global exploration of the true impact microplastics are having on our planet and our own personal health - and what scientists are doing to help fix the problem.

programme.title: Animals on the Farm
programme.desc: In this episode we go down on the farm to explore the science of the cow's 4-chambered stomach. Learn about the mysterious muscle disorder that makes certain types of goats faint. Plus, find out what horsepower really is.

programme.title: South America's Coolest Creatures
programme.desc: This show features some of the coolest creatures from the continent of South America. Find out how the Jaguar's jaws are able to crush bone. And why the Galapagos Tortoise can grow to nearly 1,000 lbs.

programme.title: Evolving Earth
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau travels to Utah where scientists have discovered a massive amount of dinosaur bones. We also go to an area where dinosaur footprints have been preserved. Then we visit Hawaii and see how these islands evolved from volcanoes. Philippe then tours an old coal mine in Pennsylvania and explores the fascinating way fossil fuels were formed.

programme.title: Ocean Exploration
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau visits the famous Woods Hole Oceanographic Institute and finds what discoveries they've recently made under the deep sea. Then we travel to the Florida coast where Philippe goes scuba diving to observe the health of their coral reefs. Then we go to Maui, Hawaii and explore the power of their massive waves with the help of a professional surfer.

programme.title: Creatures of North America
programme.desc: This show features some of the coolest creatures from the continent of North America. Find out how Canada Geese can fly over 600 miles in a single day. And how the Beaver is able to build dams stretching over 2,000 ft.

programme.title: Europe's Coolest Creatures
programme.desc: This show features some of the coolest creatures from the continent of Europe. Find out why the Mongoose is immune to cobra venom. And why 80% of the Dragonfly's brain is used to process what it sees.

programme.title: Oregon Coast
programme.desc: Jefferson Graham takes us on a photowalk through Oregon Coast

programme.title: Santa Fe, New Mexico
programme.desc: Jefferson Graham tours Santa Fe, New Mexico and shows us how to capture the best photos of the city's beautiful landmarks with your phone.

programme.title: Station Nightclub Fire
programme.desc: A survivor reflects on The Station nightclub fire on February 20, 2003 in West Warwick, Rhode Island. One hundred people died and more than 200 were injured. The fire was sparked by pyrotechnics that went off during metal band, Great White's performance. The episode looks at who did and didn't take responsibility for the fire and fire code safety measures that have changed since.

programme.title: Surfside Collapse
programme.desc: On June 24, 2021, the Champlain Towers South, a beachfront condominium in the Miami suburb of Surfside, Florida partially collapsed, killing 98 people. Family members of victims and a WPTV anchor reflect on the tragedy. The episode looks at changes in building codes and laws and research on saltwater corrosion.

programme.title: The Inside Story
programme.desc: In collaboration with "The Marshall Project." In-depth stories on criminal justice - including health care in prisons and jails, staff shortages and controversial forensic evidence.

programme.title: Crypto Crash
programme.desc: What was behind the collapse of crypto giant FTX? And what does it say about digital currencies, celebrity endorsements, and the collision of tech and finance?

programme.title: Stranded At The Border
programme.desc: In Real Life shows the reality at the U.S.-Mexico border, where people are living in dangerously poor conditions while seeking asylum.

programme.title: The Slavemaster
programme.desc: A father, husband and businessman by day transforms into a sadomasochistic by night. This veteran con-man lures unsuspecting women with a web of lies and empty promises only to trap them in a world of sex slavery and murder.

programme.title: An Opportunity To Kill
programme.desc: A wayward ex-marine drifts through central Oregon, off everyone's radar. He's homeless and forgotten about, committing petty crimes here and there, until one day he spots Amyjane and gets the urge to kill.

programme.title: A Treacherous Triangle
programme.desc: Two prominent doctors, two towns apart, are entangled in a passionate rivalry for the same woman's affections. When one loses, he exacts the ultimate revenge, hiring a friend to take out the opposition.

programme.title: Doctor Death
programme.desc: For more than a decade, a genius doctor with a homicidal hobby gets away with murder at hospitals across two continents. Cops race against incredible odds to track him down just before he takes his next job and kills…again.

programme.title: The Jigsaw Man
programme.desc: Terror strikes London, England as severed body parts start showing up at random locations across the countryside. Police must piece together the human jigsaw puzzle in order to track down the perpetrator, a common thug who's mastered the dark art of body dismemberment.

programme.title: Fit To Kill
programme.desc: A beautiful brunette is killed and left inside a burned out luxury car in the high desert. At first, it seems as though the perpetrators have gotten away with murder. As cops investigate the brutal homicide, they find a trail of missteps, which they trace back to two muscle-bound, married murderers.

programme.title: Redneck Retribution
programme.desc: A scorned mistress exacts the ultimate revenge, hiring a group of derelicts to kill the wife of her lover. When the heat comes, she plays the victim and denies any involvement, but no level of acting will allow her to escape the cold truth, the murder was caught on camera.

programme.title: Seduced To Death
programme.desc: An evil seductress targets two Georgia police, bleeding them dry, then killing them for their life insurance benefits. This black widow gets away with murder for years before law enforcement untangles her web of seduction and lies and brings her to justice.
